1.c: Distance from center of city and high taxes because of local improvements.

areaDesc.5: This area contains small, modern, one family houses and bungalows. Those to the west of this sections are larger as well as more attractive and desirable.

1.a: Terrain is high and slightly rolling.

areaDesc.5: This is an area devoted almost exclusively to two story two family dwellings. There is little variety in architecture, but a fair display of pride of ownership.
A mixture of run down, cheap, one and two family houses, bridge having been eliminated has left this area stranded.

1.a: Land is slightly high and flat.

areaDesc.5: This is a small area containing large homes attractively designed and set well back from the street. Grounds are well landscaped and streets are shaded. On Washington Road dwellings are smaller than those on Sunnyside Road.

1.c: Age of structures and gradual deterioration of neighborhood.

areaDesc.5: This once was an area of large, attractive singles many of which, in the course of time, have been converted into rooming, apartment and fraternity houses. Doubles were built at a later period. Though dwellings are built fairly closely together, there is not too much congestion.

1.a: Land rises steeply to the southeast.

areaDesc.5: This is an old and fairly congested section of the city in which the dwellings, almost exclusively doubles, are in rather dilapidated condition. The U.S. Housing Authority has constructed a 250 family unit in this area but it has done nothing except create vacancies elsewhere.

1.c: There is occasional fog and dampness in the south, near the river.
1.a: Low in south and slightly high in the north.

areaDesc.5: This is an area made up almost entirely of small, one and one-and one-half story bungalows. These are built on narrow lots and display a fair pride of ownership.

1.a: Land rises steeply to the south where it becomes high and flat.

areaDesc.5: In this area houses are a mixture of one and two story singles and two story doubles built with little or no room between.

This is a fairly old area in which doubles predominate but in which are also included a number of singles and a few triples. All are built quite closely together and evidence little pride of ownership. There were fewer foreclosures in this section than in any other.

1.c: Distance from city and places of employment.

areaDesc.5: Homes in this area are largely singles of the bungalow and small two story type. They are not built too closely together and there is a fair pride of ownership. State Street is tending toward business. Quite a number of residents are employed in Albany.
This is an area containing little variety in size and type but all dwellings are of fair age. Lots are a bit too narrow but properties are well cared for and streets are nicely shaded.

1.c: Lack of all improvements save gas and electricity.

areaDesc.5: A mixture of small, 1, 1 ½ and 2 story dwellings of varying age and of rather non-descript design, which are built on fairly narrow lots. Here and there is found more recent development, particularly along Fourth and Fifth Avenues which are slightly above the average. Much of the construction is cheaply built.

This is an area containing a mixture of small one and one and a half story singles and two story doubles of fair age. Plots are fairly narrow giving an air of slight congestion; but there is an evident pride of ownership. Streets are well shaded.

1.c: Distance from center of city and places of employment as well as lack of all improvements save gas and electricity.
1.b: Country land with room for expansion.

areaDesc.5: This is a sparsely settled section containing small one and one and a half story bungalows. These are located on plots of proportionate sizes. Pride of ownership is fairly well displayed.

1.c: Age and obsolescence of dwellings and general character of neighborhood.
1.a: Land rises steeply to the south and east.

areaDesc.5: This is an old section containing a mixture of ancient singles and doubles which are built closely together save in the sparsely developed portion. This sparsely developed portion is beyond the railroad and at a lower level. Dwellings are both one and two story of non-descript design.

1.c: Occasional fog and dampness in south, near river.
1.a: Land is low in south and slightly higher in the north.

areaDesc.5: In this area, singles are of the 1 1/2, 2 and 2 1/2 story type; set back slightly from shaded streets and built not too closely together. Pride of ownershiop is well displayed.

1.a: Fairly high ground which is somewhat rolling.

areaDesc.5: This is a section of small homes and bungalows built too closely together. Pride of ownership is very spotty.

1.c: Not very convenient and lacks all improvements, save gas and electricity.

areaDesc.5: This is an area where there are found a few small homes on occasional streets. Those on Horstman Road are newer and more desirable.

1.c: Lacks all improvements save gas and electricity.
1.a: Land is somewhat rolling and high.

areaDesc.5: An area generally sparsely developed but more built up in the south. Dwellings are of the bungalow and slightly larger type cottage with fair space between. Section has a country atmosphere. Carman has its own small shopping center.

Here is found a mixture of bungalows and slightly larger singles save on Michigan and Pennsylvania Avenues which are given over almost exclusively to two family dwellings. All lots are quite narrow. Pride of ownership is markers.

1.c: Age and obsolescence of dwellings and general character of neighborhood.

areaDesc.5: This is a very old and congested section of the city now a slum area. Plans are under way for demolition of the entire section.

This was once a fine, old residential section containing many large homes on extensive lots; a number with stables. Quite a few have been converted into boarding houses and small apartments. Others have been demolished to make way for apartment houses. Intermingled are smaller homes as well as doubles which are of substantial age and built closely together. The Washington Bridge is no longer used.

1.a: Land is low in west and higher in the east.

areaDesc.5: An old and very congested section of the city having the general appearance of a slum area. Area contains almost every type of dwelling but all in a run down condition.
A section of considerable age, composed almost entirely of two family structures with little space between. Pride of ownership is quite spotty.

This is an area which was developed prior to the enactment of zoning regulations and, as a consequences, has been developed with a considerable intermingling of both small and large homes as well as a scattering of doubles. Whereas some are considerable above the average scales; others are below as to age, size, and desirability. This condition exists throughout the section and is not limited to any definable portion. Streets are shaded and pride of ownership is marked.

This is an area of large singles of varied design located on rather extensive plottage. Grounds are well landscaped and streets are shaded. It represents the city’s most exclusive residential neighborhood. Original development of this section was by the General Electric Realty Corporation for their executives.

This is an older section containing a mixture of small and slightly larger dwellings of non-descript design occupied by the laboring class. Houses are built closely together. There is some scattered industry in this area as well as some scattered business along Van Vranken Avenue.

An old section containing a mixture of one, two and three family structures built closely together. Architecture is anything but pleasing and pride of ownership is generally absent. There is scattered business along Van Vranken Ave.
A sparsely settled section containing a mixture of shacks and small houses with an occasional two family dwelling. Many streets are not cut through although they are so shown on the map.

1.c: Distance from center of city and lack of conveniences except water, gas and electricity.
1.b: Attractiveness of entire section and low taxes.

areaDesc.5: This section contains modern homes of fair size with grounds in proportion which are well maintained. The entire area has the air of country rather than city.

1.b: Attractiveness of development and low taxes.

areaDesc.5: This is a new development of small, modern singles of varied and pleasing architecture. It is a realty development but houses are built on order by the buyers of lots which are small. It is a popular lending area with the Prudential Insurance Company of America.

6.1: Grand Boulevard Estates Town of Niskayuna

1.c: Lack of all improvements save gas and electricity.
1.a: Land rises slightly from the river.

areaDesc.5: This is an area containing a mixture of small, old bungalows and cottages.

1.c: Lack of everything except gas and electricity.
1.a: Land rises from the river and becomes rolling.

areaDesc.5: An older area containing a mixture of cottages and bungalows together with a few fair sized homes all having a country atmosphere. Alpaus is slightly more desirable than Rexford.

1.b: Attractiveness of development and low taxes.

areaDesc.5: This is a section of one family dwellings ranging from the modest to those of fair size. They are modern and of varied but attractive design. Lots are a bit too narrow but well maintained.

This section is almost entirely given over to two story two family dwellings built quite closely together. Architecture is neither varied nor overly pleasing. All of State and Albany Streets is unrestricted and tends toward business.

1.c: Lacks everything but water and electricity.

areaDesc.5: This is an area which has been sparsely developed with small bungalows and slightly larger cottages built not too closely together and displaying a fair pride of ownership.

1.a: Fairly high land which is slightly rolling.

areaDesc.5: This is a section in which dwellings, for the most part, are two story and built fairly close together. Those along the main streets are mostly two family whereas those along the side streets are singles.
